result.execSummary:
The defendant Garrett A Olson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Garrett A Olson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Garrett A Olson was found guilty of Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Garrett A Olson was found guilty of Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Cash bond is set in the amount of $1,500 (per case). If the defendant posts cash bail, the defendant must report to and comply with Pretrial Services. The defendant shall report to Pretrial Services by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail. The following checked category(s) are also ordered: _X_ GPS, __ Remote Breath (Alcohol) Monitoring, and/or __ Random Drug Testing.
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Daniel D or Katrina H. 
- Defendant shall not consume or possess alcohol. 
- Defendant shall not possess any type of dangerous weapon [as defined by Wis. Stat. 939.22(10)]. 
- Defendant shall remain in residence at all times except to attend health appointments, grocery shopping, and to attend legal matters. All are to be pre-approved by DCPS. 
NONCOMPLIANCE WILL BE REPORTED BY DCPS TO THE JUDICIARY WHO SHALL RESPOND IN ONE OF THESE WAYS: Schedule bail hearing, Increase Supervision, Issue warrant, No change but monitor.
DCPS referral

Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Laura Breun.  Will R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin. DE's motion to amend bond. Argument. Court adds conditions of: DE shall remain in residence at all times except to attend health appointments, grocery shopping, and to attend legal matters. All are to be pre-approved by DCPS. Court adds DCPS with GPS. ALL OTHER CASES ARE TO REMAIN THE SAME.

and notice of DNA and witness list - State's
Bail/bond hearing on April 11, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Information was e-filed with the court and a copy was given to the defendant; Defn waived reading of Information; Counsel enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of Defendant; motions due within 20 days. Motion to modify bail was filed by defn. State raised concern that the mtn was not noticed for today and that victims did not have notice. Court agreed it cannot be heard w/o Chpt 950 complaince. Atty Chung requested the motion be heard ASAP. Bail con't.
Trial Judge - Br 11

02:25 PM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Kathleen Chung.  Rebekah M Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State moved to find cts transactionally related. No obj. Court made such finding. Officer G.W. sworn and testified. Direct exam by ADA. Witness identified defn. Cross exam by Atty Chung. Witness excused. State moved for bindover. Defn obj. Court found probable cause and ordered bindover.
Preliminary hearing on April 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
